intro: Smithiastrum prenanthoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it well adapted to drought conditions and it is often used in xeriscaping.
